title: How accurate is Google's search trends? - Quora

response.answer_text: Somewhat accurate I’d say. For the orientation in past trends and guidance, it’s useful to see if the particular trend has the potential to grow or decline based on the past performance in the market. But one also has to use the brain and take into an account that some of the trends that had stable growth until now may not be trending anymore due to a few factors such as being “out of fashion or design”, or it’s been simply replaced by something else, and Google Trends graph doesn’t show this kind of data yet because it’s too early to fully evaluate and include in the graph. My conclusion is that Google Trends is a useful tool, along with other tools like some of the topic research and keyword research tools, but all should be used with common sense, out of the box thinking, brain, and intelligence to get most out of them.

Mostly fine but sometimes weird unexplainable stuff shows up that makes you scratch your head. I did not know St. Helena a town of like 4000 people had the world's most maniacal tech curious population.
To be very discreet, very accurate. How? Simple , google trends is showing the results of those which are being searched on google its self. So they will be very accurate about themselves.
